destinations.name: Pandora
destinations.description: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel successfully builds on the series' many strengths while repeating its pacing mistakes. 8 / 10 Vince Ingenito IGN Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel brings you more of the loot and lighthearted humor you love, though it never quite overcomes the gravity of its predecessors. 7 / 10 Cameron Woolsey GameSpot A well-executed but thoroughly unambitious extension of Borderlands 2. Low-grav jumping adds a new dimension to combat. 77 / 100 Evan Lahti PC Gamer Reviews provided by OpenCritic

experiences.name: Pandora East Coast
experiences.description: The Game of the Year map is an inaccurate portrayal of the mapped areas of Pandora. When it is compared against the Treacher's Landing and Rust Commons West maps, the Game of the Year map's ups direction appears to match their north. However, the inconsistencies with the in-game maps become apparent with its version of The Salt Flats, which by contrast has drastically rotated the notable landmarks by more than 100° around the central point. There are further inconsistencies, including the replacement of the Salt Flats' inaccessible desertscape with a sea, and highly compressed areas where the game has vast open expanses.
